title: Classroom Joke Telling
stem: Billy tells a joke to his class, and the class laughs. The next day, Billy tells another joke. In this case, laughter serves as...
explanation: The laughter (something added) increases the likelihood of Billy telling jokes in the future. Adding a pleasant stimulus to increase behavior is positive reinforcement.

title: Whining About Worksheets
stem: Jenny whines to her teacher when given a math worksheet because it's 'too hard.' The teacher removes the worksheet. The next day, Jenny whines again when given a new worksheet. In this case, removing the worksheet serves as...
explanation: Removing the aversive stimulus (worksheet) increased the whining behavior. This is negative reinforcement—removing something unpleasant to increase a behavior.

title: Missing Curfew and Phone Privileges
stem: Marcus stays out past curfew. His parents take away his phone for a week. The following weekend, Marcus comes home before curfew. In this case, taking away the phone serves as...
explanation: Removing something desirable (the phone) decreased the unwanted behavior (staying out late). This is negative punishment.

title: Sibling Poking and Yelling
stem: Sarah's younger brother keeps poking her while she's reading. Sarah yells at him loudly. The next day, her brother pokes her again. In this case, yelling serves as...
explanation: This is tricky—since the brother continued poking, the yelling actually reinforced the behavior. The attention (even negative attention) was added and increased the behavior, making it positive reinforcement.

title: Rat Lever Press: Food Pellet
stem: A rat presses a lever and receives a food pellet. The rat begins pressing the lever more frequently. The food pellet serves as...
explanation: Adding food (a pleasant stimulus) increases lever-pressing behavior. This is the classic example of positive reinforcement.

title: Rat Lever Press: Noise Cessation
stem: A rat presses a lever and an annoying loud noise stops. The rat begins pressing the lever more frequently. The cessation of noise serves as...
explanation: Removing the aversive noise increases lever-pressing. This is negative reinforcement—the behavior increases because something unpleasant is removed.

title: Dog Jumping: Water Spray
stem: Every time a dog jumps on visitors, the owner sprays water in its face. The dog eventually stops jumping on visitors. The water spray serves as...
explanation: Adding an unpleasant stimulus (water spray) decreases the jumping behavior. This is positive punishment.

title: Teen Curfew and Car Privileges
stem: A teenager comes home after curfew and loses car privileges for a month. She never misses curfew again. Removing car privileges serves as...
explanation: Removing something desirable (car privileges) decreased the late behavior. This is negative punishment.

title: Grocery Store Tantrum
stem: A child throws a tantrum in the grocery store. The parent gives the child candy to quiet them down. The child throws more tantrums on future shopping trips. The candy serves as...
explanation: Adding candy (pleasant stimulus) increased tantrum behavior. This is positive reinforcement, even though it was unintentional.

title: Employee Deadline Bonus
stem: An employee consistently meets deadlines and receives a bonus. The employee continues to meet deadlines. The bonus serves as...
explanation: Adding money (pleasant stimulus) increases deadline-meeting behavior. This is positive reinforcement.

title: Studying and Exam Exemption
stem: A student studies hard and the teacher exempts them from the final exam. The student studies hard in other classes hoping for the same result. The exam exemption serves as...
explanation: Removing the aversive stimulus (exam) increased studying behavior. This is negative reinforcement.

title: Hot Stove Burn
stem: A child touches a hot stove and gets burned. The child no longer touches the stove. The burn serves as...
explanation: The painful stimulus (burn) was added and decreased the touching behavior. This is positive punishment, even though it was a natural consequence.

title: Talking Out of Turn: Recess Loss
stem: A student talks out of turn and the teacher takes away 5 minutes of recess. The student stops talking out of turn. Losing recess serves as...
explanation: Removing something desirable (recess time) decreased the talking-out behavior. This is negative punishment.

title: Dog Sit Command: Treat
stem: A dog sits on command and receives a treat. The dog sits more reliably on command. The treat serves as...
explanation: Adding a pleasant stimulus (treat) increases sitting behavior. Classic positive reinforcement.

title: Vegetables and Dish Duty
stem: When a child finishes their vegetables, they are excused from washing dishes. The child eats vegetables more often. Being excused from dishes serves as...
explanation: Removing an aversive task (dishes) increases vegetable-eating. This is negative reinforcement.

title: Inappropriate Joke: Silent Stares
stem: A coworker makes an inappropriate joke and everyone in the room goes silent and stares. The coworker makes fewer inappropriate jokes. The silence and staring serves as...
explanation: The awkward social response was added and decreased the joke-telling. Social disapproval can function as positive punishment.

title: Misbehavior and Time-Out
stem: A child misbehaves and is sent to time-out, away from toys and attention. The child misbehaves less. Time-out serves as...
explanation: Removing access to reinforcers (toys, attention) decreased misbehavior. Time-out is a classic example of negative punishment.

title: Hand Raising in Class
stem: A student raises their hand and the teacher calls on them. The student continues raising their hand. Being called on serves as...
explanation: Adding attention and opportunity to speak (pleasant) increases hand-raising. This is positive reinforcement.

title: Aspirin for Headache
stem: A person takes aspirin for a headache and the pain goes away. They take aspirin more readily for future headaches. Pain relief serves as...
explanation: Removing pain (aversive stimulus) increases aspirin-taking behavior. This is a common real-world example of negative reinforcement.

title: Cat Scratching: Water Squirt
stem: A cat scratches the furniture and the owner squirts it with water. The cat stops scratching the furniture. The water serves as...
explanation: Adding an aversive stimulus (water) decreased scratching. This is positive punishment.

title: Staying Out Late: Allowance Withheld
stem: A teenager stays out too late and has their allowance withheld. They come home on time afterward. Withholding allowance serves as...
explanation: Removing money (desirable) decreased staying out late. This is negative punishment.

title: Pigeon Key Peck: Food
stem: A pigeon pecks a key and food appears. The pigeon pecks more frequently. The food serves as...
explanation: Adding food increases pecking behavior. This is the standard operant conditioning positive reinforcement paradigm.

title: Seatbelt and Beeping
stem: A driver fastens their seatbelt and an annoying beeping stops. They fasten their seatbelt more quickly in the future. The cessation of beeping serves as...
explanation: Removing the annoying sound increases seatbelt-fastening behavior. This is negative reinforcement built into car design.

title: Cursing: Soap in Mouth
stem: A child says a curse word and their parent washes their mouth out with soap. The child stops cursing. The soap serves as...
explanation: Adding an unpleasant taste decreased cursing behavior. This is positive punishment.

title: Rudeness: Party Exclusion
stem: A student is rude to classmates and is excluded from the class party. The student is less rude afterward. Exclusion from the party serves as...
explanation: Removing access to a fun event (desirable) decreased rude behavior. This is negative punishment.

title: Room Cleaning: Screen Time
stem: A child cleans their room without being asked and their parent gives them extra screen time. The child cleans their room more often. Extra screen time serves as...
explanation: Adding screen time (pleasant) increases room-cleaning behavior. This is positive reinforcement.

title: Competence and Reduced Micromanagement
stem: An employee who has been micromanaged earns more autonomy after demonstrating competence. They continue working competently. Gaining autonomy serves as...
explanation: Removing micromanagement (aversive) increases competent work behavior. This is negative reinforcement.

title: Cheating: Zero Grade
stem: A student cheats on a test and receives a zero. The student doesn't cheat again. The zero serves as...
explanation: Adding a bad grade (aversive consequence) decreased cheating. This is positive punishment.

title: Homework Refusal: Video Game Loss
stem: A child refuses to do homework and loses video game privileges. The child starts doing homework. Losing video games serves as...
explanation: Removing video games (desirable) decreased homework refusal. This is negative punishment.

title: Toddler Says Please: Cookie
stem: A toddler says 'please' and receives a cookie. The toddler says 'please' more often. The cookie serves as...
explanation: Adding a treat (pleasant) increases polite behavior. This is positive reinforcement.

title: Prisoner: Release from Solitary
stem: A prisoner exhibits good behavior and is released from solitary confinement. They continue behaving well. Release from solitary serves as...
explanation: Removing isolation (aversive) increases good behavior. This is negative reinforcement.

title: Dog Barking: Shock Collar
stem: A dog barks excessively and receives a mild shock from a bark collar. The dog barks less. The shock serves as...
explanation: Adding a shock (aversive) decreases barking. This is positive punishment.

title: Disrespect: Lost Rides
stem: A teenager is disrespectful and their parent stops giving them rides to see friends. The teenager becomes more respectful. Losing rides serves as...
explanation: Removing transportation (desirable privilege) decreased disrespect. This is negative punishment.

title: Sharing Toys: Praise
stem: A child shares toys with a sibling and receives praise from their parent. The child shares more in the future. Praise serves as...
explanation: Adding praise (pleasant social stimulus) increases sharing. This is positive reinforcement.

title: Extra Credit: Homework Exemption
stem: A student completes extra credit and is excused from a homework assignment. The student does more extra credit. Homework exemption serves as...
explanation: Removing homework (aversive task) increases extra credit behavior. This is negative reinforcement.

title: Lying: Apology Letter
stem: A child lies to their parent and has to write an apology letter. The child lies less often. Writing apology letters serves as...
explanation: Adding an aversive task (writing letters) decreased lying. This is positive punishment.

title: Bullying: Team Removal
stem: A student bullies others and is removed from the basketball team. The student stops bullying. Removal from the team serves as...
explanation: Removing team membership (desirable) decreased bullying. This is negative punishment.

title: Monkey Lever: Banana
stem: A monkey pulls a lever and receives a banana. The monkey pulls the lever more frequently. The banana serves as...
explanation: Adding food (pleasant) increases lever-pulling. This is positive reinforcement.

title: Factory Earplugs
stem: A worker wears earplugs and the loud factory noise becomes bearable. They wear earplugs consistently. Noise reduction serves as...
explanation: Reducing noise (aversive stimulus) increases earplug-wearing. This is negative reinforcement.

title: Bird Pecking: Beak Flick
stem: A bird pecks at a researcher and the researcher flicks the bird's beak. The bird stops pecking. The flick serves as...
explanation: Adding an aversive stimulus (flick) decreased pecking. This is positive punishment.

title: Hitting Sibling: TV Loss
stem: A child hits their sibling and is not allowed to watch their favorite show. The child stops hitting. Losing the show serves as...
explanation: Removing TV access (desirable) decreased hitting. This is negative punishment.

title: Class Participation: Extra Credit
stem: A student participates in class discussion and receives extra credit points. The student participates more. Extra credit serves as...
explanation: Adding points (pleasant) increases participation. This is positive reinforcement.

title: Chronic Pain Medication
stem: A patient takes medication and their chronic pain decreases. They continue taking the medication. Pain reduction serves as...
explanation: Removing pain (aversive) increases medication-taking. This is negative reinforcement.

title: Interrupting: Extra Chores
stem: A child interrupts adults and is given extra chores. The child interrupts less. Extra chores serve as...
explanation: Adding chores (aversive task) decreased interrupting. This is positive punishment.

title: Irresponsible Driving: Car Loss
stem: A teenager uses the car irresponsibly and loses car privileges. They drive more responsibly later. Losing car privileges serves as...
explanation: Removing car access (desirable) decreased irresponsible driving. This is negative punishment.

title: Rat Maze: Cheese
stem: A lab rat navigates a maze correctly and finds cheese at the end. The rat learns the maze faster. The cheese serves as...
explanation: Adding food reward (pleasant) increases correct maze navigation. This is positive reinforcement.

title: Sunscreen and Sunburn Prevention
stem: A person applies sunscreen and avoids getting sunburned. They apply sunscreen more consistently. Avoiding sunburn serves as...
explanation: Preventing/removing the aversive outcome (sunburn) increases sunscreen use. This is negative reinforcement.

title: Dog Counter Jumping: Yelling
stem: A dog jumps on the counter and the owner yells loudly. The dog stops jumping on the counter. Yelling serves as...
explanation: Adding a loud noise (aversive) decreased counter-jumping. This is positive punishment.

title: Unfinished Dinner: No Dessert
stem: A child doesn't finish dinner and dessert is taken away. The child finishes dinner next time. Losing dessert serves as...
explanation: Removing dessert (desirable) increased dinner-finishing behavior. This is negative punishment.

title: Athlete Training: Medal
stem: An athlete trains hard and wins a medal. The athlete trains even harder. The medal serves as...
explanation: Adding recognition/reward (pleasant) increases training behavior. This is positive reinforcement.

title: Early Assignment: Skip Practice Problems
stem: A student finishes their assignment early and doesn't have to do the extra practice problems. They finish assignments early more often. Skipping extra problems serves as...
explanation: Removing additional work (aversive) increases early completion behavior. This is negative reinforcement.

title: Puppy Chewing: Nose Tap
stem: A puppy chews on shoes and the owner taps its nose. The puppy chews on shoes less. The nose tap serves as...
explanation: Adding an aversive stimulus (tap) decreased chewing. This is positive punishment.

title: Throwing Food: Table Removal
stem: A child throws food and is removed from the dinner table. The child stops throwing food. Removal from table serves as...
explanation: Removing access to dinner/family (desirable) decreased food throwing. This is negative punishment.

title: Sales Commission
stem: A salesperson makes a sale and earns commission. They work harder to make more sales. Commission serves as...
explanation: Adding money (pleasant) increases sales behavior. This is positive reinforcement.

title: Swimming on Hot Day
stem: A swimmer dives into cool water on a hot day and feels relief. They swim more on hot days. Temperature relief serves as...
explanation: Removing discomfort from heat (aversive) increases swimming behavior. This is negative reinforcement.

title: Texting in Class: Detention
stem: A student texts during class and must stay after for detention. The student texts less in class. Detention serves as...
explanation: Adding detention (aversive) decreased texting. This is positive punishment.

title: Rule Breaking: Wi-Fi Revoked
stem: A teenager breaks a house rule and Wi-Fi access is revoked. The teenager follows rules better. Losing Wi-Fi serves as...
explanation: Removing internet access (desirable) decreased rule-breaking. This is negative punishment.

title: Good Test: Gold Star
stem: A child does well on a test and gets a gold star sticker. The child tries harder on future tests. The sticker serves as...
explanation: Adding a reward (pleasant) increases studying behavior. This is positive reinforcement.

title: Cleaning and Reduced Anxiety
stem: A person cleans their house and their anxiety about unexpected visitors decreases. They clean more regularly. Reduced anxiety serves as...
explanation: Removing anxiety (aversive internal state) increases cleaning behavior. This is negative reinforcement.

title: Writing on Walls: Scrubbing
stem: A child writes on the walls and must scrub the walls clean. The child stops writing on walls. Having to scrub serves as...
explanation: Adding an aversive task (scrubbing) decreased wall-writing. This is positive punishment.

title: Missing Curfew: No Concert
stem: A teenager misses curfew and can't go to the concert. The teenager doesn't miss curfew again. Missing the concert serves as...
explanation: Removing access to the event (desirable) decreased missing curfew. This is negative punishment.

title: Dolphin Trick: Fish
stem: A dolphin performs a trick and receives a fish. The dolphin performs more tricks. The fish serves as...
explanation: Adding food (pleasant) increases trick performance. This is positive reinforcement.

title: Noise-Canceling Headphones
stem: A student wears noise-canceling headphones and can focus better because the distracting sounds are gone. They wear the headphones more often. Blocking noise serves as...
explanation: Removing distracting sounds (aversive) increases headphone-wearing. This is negative reinforcement.

title: Biting: Eating Alone
stem: A child bites another child and must sit alone at lunch. The child bites less. Sitting alone serves as...
explanation: Removing social interaction (desirable) decreased biting. This is negative punishment—note that isolation removes something rather than adding something.

title: Rat Electrified Bar
stem: A rat touches an electrified bar and receives a shock. The rat avoids the bar. The shock serves as...
explanation: Adding pain (aversive) decreased bar-touching. This is positive punishment.

title: Bedtime Crying: Parent Stays
stem: A child cries at bedtime and the parent stays in the room longer. The child cries more at bedtime. The parent staying serves as...
explanation: This is tricky—even though the parent may not intend it, adding their presence (pleasant for child) increased crying behavior. This is positive reinforcement.

title: Exercise and Back Pain
stem: A person exercises regularly and their back pain diminishes. They continue exercising. Pain reduction serves as...
explanation: Removing pain (aversive) increases exercise behavior. This is negative reinforcement.

title: Plagiarism: F Grade
stem: A student plagiarizes and receives an F on the paper. The student doesn't plagiarize again. The F serves as...
explanation: Adding a bad grade (aversive) decreased plagiarism. This is positive punishment.

title: Mean to Pet: Pet Rehomed
stem: A child is mean to their pet and the pet is temporarily rehomed to grandma's. The child is nicer to animals. Losing the pet serves as...
explanation: Removing the pet (desirable) decreased mean behavior. This is negative punishment.

title: Blogger: Positive Comments
stem: A blogger writes a popular post and receives many positive comments. The blogger writes more posts. Comments serve as...
explanation: Adding positive feedback (pleasant) increases writing behavior. This is positive reinforcement.

title: Apologizing: Reduced Tension
stem: A person apologizes after an argument and the tension in the room decreases. They apologize more readily in the future. Reduced tension serves as...
explanation: Removing social tension (aversive) increases apologizing behavior. This is negative reinforcement.

title: Bad Manners: Eat in Kitchen
stem: A child uses bad manners at the table and must eat alone in the kitchen. The child uses better manners. Eating alone serves as...
explanation: Removing family dinner access (desirable social experience) decreased bad manners. This is negative punishment.

title: Horse Kicking: Prod
stem: A horse kicks at the trainer and the trainer pokes it with a prod. The horse kicks less. The prod serves as...
explanation: Adding an aversive stimulus (prod) decreased kicking. This is positive punishment.

title: Punctuality: Stopped Monitoring
stem: An employee comes to work on time consistently and their supervisor stops monitoring their arrival. They continue coming on time. Stopping the monitoring serves as...
explanation: Removing oversight (aversive scrutiny) increases punctuality behavior. This is negative reinforcement.

title: Gamer Achievement Badges
stem: A gamer plays skillfully and earns achievement badges. They play more to earn more badges. Badges serve as...
explanation: Adding virtual rewards (pleasant) increases skilled play. This is positive reinforcement.

title: Chores Done: No Trash Duty
stem: A child completes their chores and doesn't have to take out the trash for a week. They complete chores faster. Not taking out trash serves as...
explanation: Removing an unpleasant chore (aversive) increases chore completion. This is negative reinforcement.

title: Making Fun: Class Extra Homework
stem: A student makes fun of a classmate and the whole class is given extra homework. The student stops making fun of others. Extra homework serves as...
explanation: Adding an aversive consequence (homework, plus social pressure) decreased teasing behavior. This is positive punishment.

title: Not Sharing: Playdate Ends
stem: A child refuses to share and is removed from the playdate. The child shares more in the future. Ending the playdate serves as...
explanation: Removing play opportunity (desirable) increased sharing. This is negative punishment.

title: Musician: Mastery Feeling
stem: A musician practices a difficult piece and finally masters it, feeling proud. They practice more. The feeling of mastery serves as...
explanation: Adding an intrinsic reward (pride, mastery feelings) increases practice. This is positive reinforcement.

title: Antacids and Heartburn
stem: A person takes antacids and their heartburn goes away. They take antacids whenever they have heartburn. Heartburn relief serves as...
explanation: Removing pain (aversive) increases antacid-taking. This is negative reinforcement.

title: Dishes in Sink: Week of Dishes
stem: A teenager leaves dishes in the sink and must wash everyone's dishes for a week. They put their dishes away after that. Extra dish duty serves as...
explanation: Adding extra work (aversive) decreased leaving dishes out. This is positive punishment.

title: Rude to Grandparents: No Present
stem: A child is rude to grandparents and doesn't get to open their birthday present. The child is polite next visit. Losing the present serves as...
explanation: Removing the gift (desirable) decreased rudeness. This is negative punishment.

title: Sea Lion Ball Balance: Fish
stem: A sea lion balances a ball and receives a fish. It balances the ball more reliably. The fish serves as...
explanation: Adding food (pleasant) increases ball-balancing. This is positive reinforcement.

title: Bug Spray and Mosquitoes
stem: A hiker applies bug spray and mosquitoes stop biting. They apply bug spray more consistently. Preventing bites serves as...
explanation: Removing/preventing bites (aversive) increases bug spray use. This is negative reinforcement.

title: Parrot Biting: Back to Cage
stem: A parrot bites its owner and the owner puts it back in the cage immediately. The parrot bites less. Returning to the cage serves as...
explanation: Removing freedom/attention (desirable) decreased biting. This is negative punishment.

title: Running in Hall: Walk Slowly
stem: A child runs in the hallway at school and must walk back and forth slowly 10 times. The child stops running. Walking slowly serves as...
explanation: Adding a tedious task (aversive) decreased running. This is positive punishment (overcorrection).

title: Dog Begging: Table Scraps
stem: A dog begs at the table and occasionally receives scraps. The dog begs more persistently. Scraps serve as...
explanation: Adding food (pleasant) increases begging. This is positive reinforcement on an intermittent schedule, making it especially persistent.

title: Sunglasses and Bright Light
stem: A child puts on sunglasses and the bright light no longer hurts their eyes. They wear sunglasses more often in bright light. Reduced glare serves as...
explanation: Removing the aversive bright light increases sunglasses-wearing. This is negative reinforcement.

title: Passing Notes: Read Aloud
stem: A student passes notes in class and the teacher reads the note aloud to the class. The student stops passing notes. Public embarrassment serves as...
explanation: Adding embarrassment (aversive) decreased note-passing. This is positive punishment.

title: No Homework: No Video Games
stem: A child doesn't complete homework and can't play video games. The child completes homework next time. Losing games serves as...
explanation: Removing game access (desirable) increased homework completion. This is negative punishment.

title: Parent Gives In to Tantrum
stem: A child throws a tantrum and the parent eventually gives in and buys the toy. The parent gives in more quickly to future tantrums. For the parent, the end of the tantrum serves as...
explanation: This is tricky—from the parent's perspective, removing the aversive tantrum increased giving-in behavior. The parent is being negatively reinforced to give in.

title: Meditation and Stress
stem: A person meditates and their stress level decreases. They meditate more regularly. Stress reduction serves as...
explanation: Removing stress (aversive internal state) increases meditation behavior. This is negative reinforcement.

title: Lying: Writing Lines

explanation: Adding a tedious task (aversive) decreased lying. This is positive punishment.

title: Speeding: License Suspended
stem: A teenager is caught speeding and their license is suspended. They drive slower afterward. License suspension serves as...
explanation: Removing driving privileges (desirable) decreased speeding. This is negative punishment.

title: Yard Work: Ice Cream
stem: A child helps with yard work and gets ice cream afterward. The child volunteers to help more. Ice cream serves as...
explanation: Adding a treat (pleasant) increases helping behavior. This is positive reinforcement.

title: Allergy Medication: Sneezing Stops
stem: A patient takes allergy medication and their sneezing stops. They take the medication regularly during allergy season. Stopping sneezing serves as...
explanation: Removing sneezing (aversive) increases medication-taking. This is negative reinforcement.

title: Slamming Doors: Oil Hinges
stem: A child slams doors and must oil all the door hinges in the house. The child stops slamming doors. Having to oil hinges serves as...
explanation: Adding a chore (aversive) decreased door slamming. This is positive punishment.

title: Forgot Materials: Lost Points
stem: A student forgets to bring materials to class and loses participation points. The student remembers materials next time. Losing points serves as...
explanation: Removing points (desirable) increased remembering materials. This is negative punishment.

title: Monkey Shape Sorting: Grapes

explanation: Adding food (pleasant) increases correct sorting. This is positive reinforcement.

title: Early Project: Leave Early

explanation: Removing work time (aversive obligation) increases early completion. This is negative reinforcement.

title: Drawing on Desk: Clean All Desks
stem: A student draws on their desk and must clean all the desks in the classroom. The student stops drawing on desks. Cleaning all desks serves as...
explanation: Adding extensive cleaning (aversive) decreased drawing on desks. This is positive punishment.

title: Taking Toys: Lose Own Toy
stem: A child uses their sibling's toys without asking and loses access to their own favorite toy. The child asks permission next time. Losing their toy serves as...
